title: Wizard's Tower
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the **Wizard's Tower** is an upward-extending set of 3 consecutive levels in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"): the bottom level is between the 13th and 18th levels, and the topmost between the 11th and 16th levels, meaning that the Tower will always be between DL 36 and DL 47. The Tower itself is accessible via [magic portal](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal") in one of the [Fake Wizard's Towers](/wiki/Fake_Wizard%27s_Tower "Fake Wizard's Tower"), and the outer maze may also contain the stairs to [Vlad's Tower](/wiki/Vlad%27s_Tower "Vlad's Tower").

All three levels are [non-teleportable](/wiki/Non-teleport_level "Non-teleport level") and have undiggable floors; only the middle level is eligible to leave [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") files. The top and bottom levels are considered [graveyards](/wiki/Graveyard "Graveyard").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Maps](#Maps)

  - [1.1 Bottom level](#Bottom_level)
  - [1.2 Middle level](#Middle_level)
  - [1.3 Top level](#Top_level)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 References](#References)

## Maps

Each level of the Tower consists of a central core (the Tower proper) surrounded by normal maze which contains the stairs allowing passage through Gehennom; it is impossible to reach one area from the other (the outer walls of the Tower being undiggable and unphasable). It is impossible to [levelport](/wiki/Levelport "Levelport") into the tower from outside, but from inside the tower you can levelport either within the tower or to a non-tower level (for instance, to the [vibrating square](/wiki/Vibrating_square "Vibrating square") level after grabbing the [Book of the Dead](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead "Book of the Dead")).

### Bottom level

| Wizard's Tower, bottom                              |                                                      |
| --------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Location                                            | Level 13–18 of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") |
| [Bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")                        | No                                                   |
| [Mappable](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping")     | Yes                                                  |
| [Teleportable](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation") | No                                                   |
| [Diggable floor](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                                   |
| [Diggable walls](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | Maze and small central tower only                    |

\----------------------------  
|..|............[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")..........|  
|..|..------------------[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")--|  
|..|..|.........|..........|  
|..[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")..|.[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|..........|  
|..|..|.;[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")---[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat");.|-[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")--------|  
|..|..|.[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")--[^](/wiki/Squeaky_board "Squeaky board")--[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|..|.......|  
|..|..|.[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")|[​L](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)")[<](/wiki/Ladder "Ladder")[V](/wiki/Vampire_lord "Vampire lord")|[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|h.|.......|  
|..---|.:--[^](/wiki/Squeaky_board "Squeaky board")--:.|i.|.......|  
|.....|.[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")---[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|v.|......[​D](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon")|  
|.....[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door").[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|e.|.......|  
|.....|.........|..[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door").....[^](/wiki/Magic_portal "Magic portal").|  
\----------------------------

You arrive in (and leave) the Tower at the magic [portal](/wiki/Portal "Portal") marked in the lower right. The small central tower contains a [vampire lord](/wiki/Vampire_lord "Vampire lord") and a random [lich](/wiki/Lich_\(monster_class\) "Lich (monster class)"); the four non-ladder squares have squeaky boards. The [moat](/wiki/Moat "Moat") surrounding it contains two [giant eels](/wiki/Giant_eel "Giant eel") and two [krakens](/wiki/Kraken "Kraken"). There is a random [dragon](/wiki/Dragon "Dragon") near the portal, and the marked [beehive](/wiki/Beehive "Beehive") is filled with the usual [queen bee](/wiki/Queen_bee "Queen bee") and nine [killer bees](/wiki/Killer_bee "Killer bee"); in addition, randomly placed around the mapped area (or the long corridor of the outer maze immediately to its right) are three random [demons](/wiki/Demon_\(monster_class\) "Demon (monster class)"), a random dragon, and a random lich; two random [scrolls](/wiki/Scroll "Scroll"), a random [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon"), a random [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), and a random [tool](/wiki/Tool "Tool"). There is a random [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet") on the upladder. All walls are undiggable and unphasable save those of the small central tower.

### Middle level

| Wizard's Tower, middle                              |                                                      |
| --------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Location                                            | Level 12–17 of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") |
| [Bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")                        | Yes                                                  |
| [Mappable](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping")     | Yes                                                  |
| [Teleportable](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation") | No                                                   |
| [Diggable floor](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                                   |
| [Diggable walls](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | Maze only                                            |

\----------------------------  
|.....|.[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")...[<](/wiki/Ladder "Ladder")|.............|  
|.....|.-------[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")--------[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")--|  
|.....|.|.........|........|  
|..-[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")--[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")|.........|........|  
|..|....|.........|------[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")-|  
|..|["](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet")...|...zoo...|.....|..|  
\|-[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")-----|.........|.....|..|  
|.......|.........|[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")--[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")--..|  
|.......|.........|.|......|  
\|-----[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")----[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")------|.|......|  
|............|[>](/wiki/Ladder "Ladder")...[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door").|......|  
\----------------------------

In addition to the usual monsters and gold in the marked [zoo](/wiki/Zoo "Zoo"), there is a random amulet in the small room in the centre-left (marked "); also, randomly placed around the mapped area (or the long corridor of the outer maze immediately to its right) are two scrolls, two [potions](/wiki/Potion "Potion"), and a [spellbook](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook"); a spiked pit, a sleeping gas trap, an anti-magic trap, and a magic trap. All walls are undiggable and unphasable.

### Top level

| Wizard's Tower, top                                 |                                                      |
| --------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Location                                            | Level 11–16 of [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") |
| [Bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones")                        | No                                                   |
| [Mappable](/wiki/Magic_mapping "Magic mapping")     | Yes                                                  |
| [Teleportable](/wiki/Teleportation "Teleportation") | No                                                   |
| [Diggable floor](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | No                                                   |
| [Diggable walls](/wiki/Digging "Digging")           | Maze and small central tower only                    |

\----------------------------  
|.......|..|.........|.....|  
|.......[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")..|.[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|.....|  
|..--[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")--|..|.[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")---[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|---[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")-|  
|..|....|..|.[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")--[^](/wiki/Squeaky_board "Squeaky board")--[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|..|..|  
|..|..[>](/wiki/Ladder "Ladder").|..|.[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")|[d](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound")[@](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor")[V](/wiki/Vampire_lord "Vampire lord")|[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|..|..|  
|..|-------|.[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")--[^](/wiki/Squeaky_board "Squeaky board")--[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|..|..|  
|..|.......|.[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")---[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|..|..|  
|..[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door").......|.[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat")[}](/wiki/Moat "Moat").|..|..|  
|..|.......|.........|..|..|  
|..|.......|-----------[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")-[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")-|  
|..|.......[S](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door")...............|  
\----------------------------

The [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") occupies the centre of the small tower, standing on the [Book of the Dead](/wiki/Book_of_the_Dead "Book of the Dead"). The four squares around him have [squeaky boards](/wiki/Squeaky_board "Squeaky board"); a [hell hound](/wiki/Hell_hound "Hell hound") and a [vampire lord](/wiki/Vampire_lord "Vampire lord") are next to him, and the moat contains four giant eels, four krakens, and two [piranhas](/wiki/Piranha "Piranha"). Randomly placed around the mapped area (or the long corridor of the outer maze immediately to its right) are four random demons, a random dragon, and a random [giant](/wiki/Giant "Giant"); three random spellbooks, two random scrolls, two random potions, and a [ruby](/wiki/Gem "Gem"); and a spiked pit, a sleeping gas trap, an anti-magic trap, and a magic trap (in addition to the four marked squeaky boards). The only entrance to the walkway surrounding the moat is via a secret [door](/wiki/Door "Door") randomly located in the west, east, or south walls (walls shown in red). All walls are undiggable and unphasable save those of the small central tower.

## Strategy

The Wizard's Tower contains many reasons to clear it out (beehive, loot, etc.) but you can avoid most of it if you want. Once in the tower itself via the portal, you can [level teleport](/wiki/Level_teleport "Level teleport") up two levels and you will appear randomly within the top level. Beware as you may be overwhelmed by monsters surrounding you!

Alternatively, you can wake up the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") from outside with your or a pet [mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer")'s psychic blast, or with a [drum of earthquake](/wiki/Drum_of_earthquake "Drum of earthquake"), or by getting a pet inside (e.g. using a [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle")). Rodney will then bring you the Book.

Finally, you could "teleport" into the tower if you let your pet purple worm swallow you under conflict, end conflict immediately, and then magic whistle both of you around.

## History

In [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"), any use of the [aggravate](/wiki/Aggravate "Aggravate") [monster spell](/wiki/Monster_spell "Monster spell") can awaken the Wizard from outside his Tower, making it wise not to tarry on his level. This bug is fixed in [NetHack 3.6.1](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.1 "NetHack 3.6.1") via [commit 04bc0480](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/04bc048073e87c55e3bcfa3fceab44fe86361e8a).

## References

*This page is based on a spoiler by [Dylan O'Donnell](https://alt.org/nethack/mirror/www.spod-central.org/%257Epsmith/). The original license is:*

Redistribution, copying, and editing of these spoilers, with or without modification, are permitted provided that the following conditions are met:

1. The original contributors to any spoiler must continue to be credited.
2. Any modifications to the spoiler must be acknowledged and credited.

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.
html:
Wizard's Tower

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, the Wizard's Tower is an upward-extending set of 3 consecutive levels in Gehennom: the bottom level is between the 13th and 18th levels, and the topmost between the 11th and 16th levels, meaning that the Tower will always be between DL 36 and DL 47. The Tower itself is accessible via magic portal in one of the Fake Wizard's Towers, and the outer maze may also contain the stairs to Vlad's Tower.

All three levels are non-teleportable and have undiggable floors; only the middle level is eligible to leave bones files. The top and bottom levels are considered graveyards.

Contents

  • 1 Maps
    • 1.1 Bottom level
    • 1.2 Middle level
    • 1.3 Top level
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 References

Maps

Each level of the Tower consists of a central core (the Tower proper) surrounded by normal maze which contains the stairs allowing passage through Gehennom; it is impossible to reach one area from the other (the outer walls of the Tower being undiggable and unphasable). It is impossible to levelport into the tower from outside, but from inside the tower you can levelport either within the tower or to a non-tower level (for instance, to the vibrating square level after grabbing the Book of the Dead).

Bottom level

Wizard's Tower, bottom
Location Level 13–18 of
Gehennom
Bones No
Mappable Yes
Teleportable No
Diggable floor No
Diggable walls Maze and small central tower only

|..|..------------------S--|

|..---|.:--^--:.|i.|.......|

----------------------------

You arrive in (and leave) the Tower at the magic portal marked in the lower right. The small central tower contains a vampire lord and a random lich; the four non-ladder squares have squeaky boards. The moat surrounding it contains two giant eels and two krakens. There is a random dragon near the portal, and the marked beehive is filled with the usual queen bee and nine killer bees; in addition, randomly placed around the mapped area (or the long corridor of the outer maze immediately to its right) are three random demons, a random dragon, and a random lich; two random scrolls, a random weapon, a random potion, and a random tool. There is a random amulet on the upladder. All walls are undiggable and unphasable save those of the small central tower.

Middle level

Wizard's Tower, middle
Location Level 12–17 of
Gehennom
Bones Yes

----------------------------

In addition to the usual monsters and gold in the marked zoo, there is a random amulet in the small room in the centre-left (marked "); also, randomly placed around the mapped area (or the long corridor of the outer maze immediately to its right) are two scrolls, two potions, and a spellbook; a spiked pit, a sleeping gas trap, an anti-magic trap, and a magic trap. All walls are undiggable and unphasable.

Top level

Wizard's Tower, top
Location Level 11–16 of
Gehennom
Bones No
Mappable Yes
Teleportable No
Diggable floor No
Diggable walls Maze and small central tower only
----------------------------
|.......|..|.........|.....|
|.......S..|.}}}}}}}.|.....|
|..--S--|..|.}}---}}.|---S-|
|..|....|..|.}--^--}.|..|..|
|..|..>.|..|.}|d@V|}.|..|..|
|..|-------|.}--^--}.|..|..|
|..|.......|.}}---}}.|..|..|
|..S.......|.}}}}}}}.|..|..|
|..|.......|.........|..|..|
|..|.......|-----------S-S-|
|..|.......S...............|
----------------------------

The Wizard of Yendor occupies the centre of the small tower, standing on the Book of the Dead. The four squares around him have squeaky boards; a hell hound and a vampire lord are next to him, and the moat contains four giant eels, four krakens, and two piranhas. Randomly placed around the mapped area (or the long corridor of the outer maze immediately to its right) are four random demons, a random dragon, and a random giant; three random spellbooks, two random scrolls, two random potions, and a ruby; and a spiked pit, a sleeping gas trap, an anti-magic trap, and a magic trap (in addition to the four marked squeaky boards). The only entrance to the walkway surrounding the moat is via a secret door randomly located in the west, east, or south walls (walls shown in red). All walls are undiggable and unphasable save those of the small central tower.

Strategy

The Wizard's Tower contains many reasons to clear it out (beehive, loot, etc.) but you can avoid most of it if you want. Once in the tower itself via the portal, you can level teleport up two levels and you will appear randomly within the top level. Beware as you may be overwhelmed by monsters surrounding you!

Alternatively, you can wake up the Wizard of Yendor from outside with your or a pet mind flayer's psychic blast, or with a drum of earthquake, or by getting a pet inside (e.g. using a magic whistle). Rodney will then bring you the Book.

Finally, you could "teleport" into the tower if you let your pet purple worm swallow you under conflict, end conflict immediately, and then magic whistle both of you around.

History

In NetHack 3.6.0, any use of the aggravate monster spell can awaken the Wizard from outside his Tower, making it wise not to tarry on his level. This bug is fixed in NetHack 3.6.1 via commit 04bc0480.

References

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

In ''[[NetHack]]'', the '''Wizard's Tower''' is an upward-extending set of 3 consecutive levels in [[Gehennom]]: the bottom level is between the 13th and 18th levels, and the topmost between the 11th and 16th levels, meaning that the Tower will always be between DL 36 and DL 47. The Tower itself is accessible via [[magic portal]] in one of the [[Fake Wizard's Tower]]s, and the outer maze may also contain the stairs to [[Vlad's Tower]]. All three levels are [[non-teleport level|non-teleportable]] and have undiggable floors; only the middle level is eligible to leave [[bones]] files. The top and bottom levels are considered [[graveyard]]s. ==Maps== Each level of the Tower consists of a central core (the Tower proper) surrounded by normal maze which contains the stairs allowing passage through Gehennom; it is impossible to reach one area from the other (the outer walls of the Tower being undiggable and unphasable). The [[Wizard of Yendor]] occupies the centre of the small tower, standing on the [[Book of the Dead]]. The four squares around him have [[squeaky board]]s; a [[hell hound]] and a [[vampire lord]] are next to him, and the moat contains four giant eels, four krakens, and two [[piranha]]s. Randomly placed around the mapped area (or the long corridor of the outer maze immediately to its right) are four random demons, a random dragon, and a random [[giant]]; three random spellbooks, two random scrolls, two random potions, and a [[gem|ruby]]; and a spiked pit, a sleeping gas trap, an anti-magic trap, and a magic trap (in addition to the four marked squeaky boards). The only entrance to the walkway surrounding the moat is via a secret [[door]] randomly located in the west, east, or south walls (walls shown in red). All walls are undiggable and unphasable save those of the small central tower. ==Strategy== The Wizard's Tower contains many reasons to clear it out (beehive, loot, etc.) but you can avoid most of it if you want. Once in the tower itself via the portal, you can [[level teleport]] up two levels and you will appear randomly within the top level. Beware as you may be overwhelmed by monsters surrounding you! Alternatively, you can wake up the [[Wizard of Yendor]] from outside with your or a pet [[mind flayer]]'s psychic blast, or with a [[drum of earthquake]], or by getting a pet inside (e.g. using a [[magic whistle]]). Rodney will then bring you the Book. Finally, you could "teleport" into the tower if you let your pet purple worm swallow you under conflict, end conflict immediately, and then magic whistle both of you around. ==History== In [[NetHack 3.6.0]], any use of the [[aggravate]] [[monster spell]] can awaken the Wizard from outside his Tower, making it wise not to tarry on his level. This bug is fixed in [[NetHack 3.6.1]] via {{commit|04bc048073e87c55e3bcfa3fceab44fe86361e8a}}. ==References== {{DOD}} {{nethack-343}} [[Category:Special levels]]
